title: Minister of Foreign Affairs advocates enhancement of ECOSOC’s role to address global crisis
text: Minister of Foreign Affairs and the National Community Abroad, Mr Ramtane Lamamra, on Friday advocated the enhancement of the role of the High-level Segment (HLS) of the United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC), urging further attention to the issues of particular interest to developing countries.Speaking at meeting held by videoconference on the occasion of the ECOSOC’s 75th anniversary, Mr Lamamra advocated “the enhancement of the role of the High-level Segment (HLS) of the United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC),” urging further attention to the issues of particular interest to developing countries.The Foreign Minister also called the Council to focus more on developing countries, by ensuring that more space is dedicated to issues related to financing for development, external debt problems, and infrastructure. As for the implementation of the Agenda 2030 for sustainable development, Mr Lamamra emphasized the need to strengthen multilateral cooperation mechanisms and to ensure the full and timely disbursement of their financial pledges, thereby meeting their official development assistance commitments. “ECOSOC could contribute to the convergence and coordination of efforts and avoid overlap and duplication by encouraging consistent alignment on the 2030 Agenda,” stressed the Foreign Minister.
